thread.title: Kansas got away with a blatant travel on its game-winner against Kansas State
thread.title_full: Kansas got away with a blatant travel on its game-winner against Kansas State

author: Ricky O'Donnell
title: Kansas got away with a blatant travel on its game-winner against Kansas State
text:
Kansas State lost to the Jayhawks on a blatant travel that went uncalled in the final seconds.
SVI MYKHAILIUK FOR THE WIN! Svi goes to coast to coast in 5.6 seconds to give #3 Kansas a 90-88 win over K-State pic.twitter.com/SXTDqo4fgB 
— March Madness 2017 (@Madness2017) January 4, 2017 Kansas State was so close to ending Kansas’ 46-game home winning streak on Tuesday night, until a coast-to-coast layup by Svi Mykhailiuk lifted the Jayhawks at the buzzer. There’s only one problem: Mykhailiuk pretty clearly traveled, but the refs never called it.
Count the steps: 1, 2, 3. 
Kansas State won’t be happy about this, but Bruce Weber’s team certainly played a great game at Allen Fieldhouse. K-State will get another shot at the Jayhawks on Feb. 6, this time at their house.
